The self-titled release eschews The Runaways overdrive sound in favor of girl-group melodicism and snappy new wave tempos. Producer Fowley (who also takes credit as Ã¢â‚¬Å“directorÃ¢â‚¬Â) wrote or co-wrote almost all the songs on this LP, and while there are no flashes of brilliance, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s consistently listenable and enjoyable.

 

Lead vocalist Jan King (not the author of the same name!) shows a lot of range, coasting through the ballads, rockers and mid-tempo numbers with ease.

A few years after The Orchids came and went, several all-women bands like The Go-Go's and The Bangles reaped lots of commercial success with similar sounds.
